text: The Faisal Mosque is a mosque in Islamabad, the capital of Pakistan. It is the National mosque of Pakistan, and one of the largest mosques in the Islamic world. It is named after King Faisal of Saudi Arabia. It was the biggest mosque for over six years between 1986 and 1993). == Gallery == Image:faisalMasjid.jpg|Faisal Mosque at night Image:Faisal-Mosque- JG-01.jpg|Faisal Mosque in March 1986 to 2006 Image:Night view of Faisal Mosque in Islamabad.jpg|Night view of the Faisal Mosque and surrounding area Image:Inside Shah Faisal Mosque.jpg|Interior of the mosque. == References == == Other websites == * Click here to see a highly detailed 3D Model of Faisal Masjid in Google Earth. * Faisal Mosque - ArchNet Digital Library * Faisal Mosque - World is Round Category:Buildings and structures in Islamabad Category:Mosques in Asia Category:National symbols of Pakistan Category:Religious buildings and structures in Pakistan Category:1986 establishments in Asia Category:20th-century establishments in Pakistan
title: Faisal Mosque
